senses.definition: people who do not have enough food to eat
causing you to feel that you want to eat something

examples.x: All this gardening is hungry work.

senses.definition: having or showing a strong desire for something

senses.definition: an act of looking for somebody/something that is difficult to find

senses.definition: an act of going after wild animals to kill or capture them

senses.definition: to have a chance of winning

senses.definition: to be involved in a situation so that you will gain or lose according to the result

senses.definition: to look for somebody in order to catch them or harm them

examples.x: Police are hunting an escaped criminal.

senses.definition: (in the UK) to go after and kill foxes as a sport, riding horses and using dogs. Fox hunting with dogs has been illegal in England and Wales since 2005, but people still ride out with dogs following a scent trail, without an actual fox.

senses.definition: going after and killing wild animals as a sport or for food

senses.definition: a sport in which foxes are hunted by specially trained dogs and by people on horses. Fox hunting with dogs is now illegal in the UK.
the process of looking for something

examples.x: How's the job-hunting going?

hurricane victims
hurricane-force winds

senses.definition: the need or wish to get something done quickly

examples.x: In my hurry to leave, I forgot my passport.

senses.definition: very quickly or more quickly than usual

examples.x: He had to leave in a hurry.

senses.definition: not having enough time to do something

senses.definition: impatient to do something

senses.definition: having plenty of time

examples.x: I don't mind waiting—I'm not in any particular hurry.

senses.definition: not wanting or not willing to do something

senses.definition: to make somebody do something more quickly

senses.definition: to deal with something quickly

examples.x: Her application was hurried through.

senses.definition: to do something too quickly

examples.x: A good meal should never be hurried.

senses.definition: injured physically

senses.definition: upset and offended by something that somebody has said or done

senses.definition: to feel painful

examples.cf: it hurts somebody to do something

senses.definition: to feel unhappy or upset

examples.x: I know you're hurting and I want to help you.

senses.definition: to have a bad effect on somebody/something

senses.definition: to be in a difficult situation because you need something, especially money

senses.definition: to affect somebody where they will feel it most
used to say that somebody should do a particular thing

examples.x: It wouldn't hurt you to help with the housework occasionally.

senses.definition: to be kind and gentle and unwilling to cause unhappiness

a husband-and-wife team

senses.definition: a chemical element. Hydrogen is a gas that is the lightest of all the elements. It combines with oxygen to form water.

examples.x: to formulate/confirm a hypothesis
a hypothesis about the function of dreams
